New Records: Willy Adames became the first primary shortstop in franchise history to hit 30 homers and record 100 RBIs in a season.
Tobias Myers struck out 11 batters, a new career high.
Key Match Events: Willy Adames and Gary Sánchez hit back-to-back homers in the first inning.
William Contreras hit a solo shot in the third inning.
Tobias Myers allowed just one run on four hits in six innings, walking one and striking out 11.
Ryan McMahon’s homer in the fourth was Colorado’s only damage off of Tobias Myers.
Pre-Game Insights: Pat Murphy emphasized the importance of leadership in the team before Saturday’s game.
Post-Match Reflections: Pat Murphy expressed his satisfaction with the win, saying 'I liked winning tonight, man. I love winning tonight.'
Tobias Myers reflected on the team's resilience, stating 'We just never give up. Even when we lose a game, we always have the tying run at the plate; we always have a chance.'
